PageTitle: ds-lite alarm user port-number threshold (DS-Lite instance view)
FuncDef:
The ds-lite alarm user port-number threshold command sets an alarm threshold for user-based port usage so that an alarm is generated if the threshold is reached.
The undo ds-lite alarm user port-number threshold command restores the default alarm threshold for user-based port usage.
The default alarm threshold for user-based port usage is 80%.
CLIs: undo ds-lite alarm user port-number threshold [ <alarm-threshold-value> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Sets an alarm threshold for user-based port usage.
User-based port usage = Actual number of ports used by a user/Number of ports available for the user.
The value is an integer ranging from 60 to 100, in percentage. The default value is 80.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To monitor user-based port usage on a DS-Lite device, run the ds-lite alarm user port-number threshold command to set an alarm threshold for user-based port usage to enable the DS-Lite device to generate an alarm if the threshold is reached.
Configuration Impact
If user-based port usage reaches the specified alarm threshold, a service board sends an alarm to the NMS. If user-based port usage exceeds the alarm threshold, the service board does not repeatedly send an alarm. After user-based port usage falls to 7/8 of the threshold, the service board sends a clear alarm to the NMS.
Precautions
The number of user-specific pre-allocated ports is equal to the number of ports configured in the port-range command run in the DS-Lite instance view. Usage of user-specific ports is equal to the number of user-specific ports in use divided by the number of user-specific pre-allocated ports. The ds-lite alarm user port-number threshold command takes effect only after the port-range command is run in the DS-Lite instance view. If usage of user-specific ports in use is greater than the alarm threshold (80% by default) for usage-specific port usage, an alarm indicating that usage of user-specific ports in use exceeds the threshold is generated.
